instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPUIMVP_PGOOD: What is CPUIMVP_PGOOD? CPUIMVP_PGOOD is a signal from the CPU VCORE buck converter IC that indicates CPU power is good which is necessary to create PM_S0_PGOOD..
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
Customer said it was showing colours on the display from time to time then just went dead.

USB mouse doesn't light up, never chimes, PRM Reset does nothing and fan spins high.

CPUVCore @ <CAPACITOR>C1655</CAPACITOR> is 0.678v and Diode to ground is 0.001v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
So I noticed the TP for <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_ISUM</SIGNAL> was corroded and broken. I ran a jumper from <RESISTOR>R7407</RESISTOR> -> <RESISTOR>R7406</RESISTOR> and to <RESISTOR>R7410</RESISTOR>.

Now, with no ram I get a ram beep. If I insert ram the fan spins for a few seconds, then stops and spins for a few seconds again, then stops etc....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message: It's like it's trying to pass POST but something is browning out and stopping the process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
PGoods are unstable.

<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_PGOOD</SIGNAL> sits at 3.3v, then bottoms out to 0v, back up again.
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_AXG_PGOOD</SIGNAL> floats around 200mV.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message: Ugh, this can be so many things :( There must be more corrosion somewhere else, inspect carefully.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 34203"]Ugh, this can be so many things :( There must be more corrosion somewhere else, inspect carefully. [/QUOTE]

The board is in oddly good condition aside from that single test point. I have gone over it closely and not found anything.

Could that test point link to or something else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message: Actually, a test point near <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR> is a little corroded too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message: It could be anything, there is no way to diagnose this with measuring things. Inspect everything, maybe give the SMC some flux and heat.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
I ran some flux around the SMC, but no change.

Have noticed that <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TONA</SIGNAL> & B drop down to 0.6v when the fan spins, then pop up to 12.58 when it stops @ <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>::1 & <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>::1 but the voltage on ::2 stays at 12.58v. Could this be a faulty <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pulling it down?


After this I'm out of ideas as the board looks spotless.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
Actually a working board is the same.

Out of ideas. :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Brain dead.
threads.message:
Have noticed that <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TONA</SIGNAL> & B drop down to 0.6v when the fan spins, then pop up to 12.58 when it stops @ <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>::1 & <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>::1 but the voltage on ::2 stays at 12.58v. Could this be a faulty <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pulling it down?

That is totally normal. 

This board is not going to happen, sorry.
